content: The success of Anthropic's CLI agent, "Claude Code," is primarily due to a radical simplification in its architecture, specifically a single-threaded "Master Loop" combined with highly capable models, rather than complex agentic frameworks.

The "give it tools and get out of the way" approach describes an agent architecture that provides powerful tools to a highly capable model and minimizes complex orchestrating frameworks, contrasting with earlier, more brittle DAG-based (Directed Acyclic Graph) architectures.
Claude Code's internal tools include Bash, FileEdit, and Grep, which are critical for its operation.
The "Todo" planning mechanism, sandboxing, and system prompts play a critical role in making Claude Code reliable for production engineering tasks.
